1.0.name: wordpress/s-crib-otp-authentication
1.0.description:
S-CRIB OTP Authenticator for WordPress works with Password sCrib, Google Authenticator, Pledge (McAfee), DS3 OATH, AWToken, and other OTP generators. It creates QR codes (Google Authenticator or Pledge) and also allows to type OTP secrets manually.

S-CRIB OTP Authenticator introduces one time password (OTP) authentication into Wordpress (version 1.3 supports counter/event mode only). The plugin has been design for use with Password sCrib dongles but we also tested it with Google Authenticator (iOS, Android), Pledge (iOS, Android), DS3 OATH (iOS, Android), and AWToken. It is compliant with RFC4226 when the OTP code can be 6, 7, or 8 digits long.

You can enable OTP on your account through "Edit My Profile" page (accessible from top right corner when logged in). Administrators can do the same for other users by selecting their names from from the list of users

You can set OTP secret as well as PIN - highly recommended as the minimum length of OTP codes should be
